docs.snippet: IN 1811 Uruguay began the long process of winning independence. In this bicentennial year, Montevideo, the capital, has been adding new museums and expanding older ones as the country re-examines art and history.     The most striking addition is the...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN 1811 Uruguay began the long process of winning independence. In this bicentennial year, Montevideo, the capital, has been adding new museums and expanding older ones as the country re-examines art and history. The most striking addition is the Espacio de Arte Contemporáneo (Arenal Grande 1930; 598-2-929-2066; www.eac.gub.uy), which opened in July 2010 in an abandoned 1888 prison occupying an entire city block between the Cordón and Aguada neighborhoods, an area with a post-industrial feel and unassuming working-class homes.
docs.abstract: Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay, is celebrating its bicentennial year by adding new museums and expanding older ones as the country re-examines art and history in effort to attract tourists; photo (M)

headline.main: In Montevideo, Prison Cells as Galleries

docs.snippet: Paolo Guerrero scored three goals and set up another in La Plata, Argentina, as Peru defeated Venezuela, 4-1, to finish third in the Copa América. Uruguay and Paraguay will play in the final Sunday. (AP)       Rafael Da Silva scored in the 76th...
docs.lead_paragraph: Paolo Guerrero scored three goals and set up another in La Plata, Argentina, as Peru defeated Venezuela, 4-1, to finish third in the Copa América. Uruguay and Paraguay will play in the final Sunday. (AP) Rafael Da Silva scored in the 76th minute to give the lead to Manchester United, which went on to beat the Chicago Fire, 3-1, in an exhibition match at Soldier Field. (AP)
docs.abstract: Peru defeats Venezuela, 4-1, in third-place match at Copa America tournament in Argentina; other soccer news noted. (S)

headline.main: Peru Takes Third Place in Copa América
